intro: Bidens atriplicifolia, commonly known as the blackleaf beggarlice, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and often have a dark green to almost black coloration, which gives it its common name. Bidens atriplicifolia is an annual herb that produces small yellow flowers and is often found in disturbed or wetland environments.
